data.event: Economic expansion began but "stagflation" persisted. Election year focused on economic challenges.
Carter took office facing continued economic challenges. Energy crisis remained a major concern.
Federal Reserve raised rates dramatically to fight inflation, reaching 20%. Airline industry deregulated.
Second oil crisis hit economy. Federal Reserve under Volcker began aggressive anti-inflation policy.
Recession began as anti-inflation measures took effect. Carter-Reagan election focused on economy.
Reagan took office implementing supply-side economics. Tax cuts passed. Minimum wage raised to $3.35.
Severe recession continued. Job Training Partnership Act passed to address unemployment. Garn-St. Germain Act deregulated savings and loans.
Reagan increased military spending significantly as part of Cold War strategy. Recovery began but unemployment remained high.
Strong recovery continued with "Morning in America" campaign theme. Fed maintained anti-inflation stance.
Economic expansion continued with falling inflation. Plaza Accord addressed international currency imbalances.
Tax reform simplified code and lowered rates. Oil prices collapsed affecting energy sector.
Black Monday stock market crash rattled financial markets but had limited economic impact.
Federal Reserve raised rates to prevent inflation as economy strengthened.
George H.W. Bush took office. Savings and Loan Crisis reforms implemented to address financial sector problems.
Recession began. Gulf War preparations began affecting oil markets and economy.
Operation Desert Storm launched. Minimum wage raised to $4.25. Soviet Union dissolved affecting global markets.
NAFTA negotiations completed but not yet implemented. Recovery remained slow with "jobless recovery" concerns.
Clinton took office. Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act raised taxes and cut spending to reduce deficit.
School to Work Act passed to address skills gap. Fed began raising rates to prevent inflation.
Economic expansion gained momentum. Technology sector began dramatic growth.
Welfare reform fundamentally changed social safety net. Economy strengthened further.
Minimum wage raised to $5.85. Asian financial crisis began but had limited U.S. impact.
Long-Term Capital Management crisis threatened financial markets but was contained.
Euro introduced affecting global markets. Tech boom accelerated. Kosovo conflict created uncertainty.
Nasdaq reached record high before tech bubble burst. Presidential election created uncertainty.
George W. Bush took office and implemented tax cuts. 9/11 attacks dramatically impacted economy.
War on Terror began affecting government spending and economic confidence. Corporate scandals (Enron, WorldCom) shook markets.
Jobs and Growth Tax Relief Reconciliation Act passed to stimulate economy. Iraq War began.
Economic expansion strengthened. Housing boom accelerated.
Bankruptcy law reformed. Hurricane Katrina caused massive economic damage to Gulf Coast.
Housing market peaked before beginning historic decline. Economic expansion continued.
Financial crisis began with subprime mortgage collapse. Housing decline accelerated.
Financial crisis peaked. Minimum wage raised to $6.55. Major financial institutions failed or required rescue.
Obama took office implementing stimulus package. Minimum wage raised to $7.25. Auto industry bailout. Extended jobless benefits.
Obama tax cuts implemented to support recovery. Dodd-Frank Act reformed financial sector.
Extended period of job losses reached 26 months. Debt ceiling crisis created market uncertainty. Iraq War ended.
Quantitative easing continued. Ten-year rates hit 200-year low. Fiscal cliff crisis created uncertainty.
Stock market gained 30% as recovery strengthened. Federal Reserve continued accommodative policy.
Unemployment finally returned to pre-crisis levels. Oil prices declined sharply.
Economy reached "natural" unemployment rate. Fed began normalizing monetary policy.
Presidential election created market volatility. Brexit vote affected global markets.
Trump took office. Dollar weakened boosting exports. Tax cut legislation passed.
Trump tax cuts implemented. Trade tensions increased with China and other partners.
"Goldilocks" economy with low unemployment and inflation. Trade tensions continued.
COVID-19 pandemic caused severe recession. Massive government stimulus implemented.
Pandemic recovery continued. Biden took office implementing additional stimulus. Supply chain issues emerged.
Strong recovery continued. Federal Reserve aggressively raised rates to fight inflation.
